ca.ualberta.cmput301f20t04.bookatmenow

Class BookList

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301f20t04.bookatmenow.BookList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RequestList
    Deprecated.

    public abstract class BookList
extends android.widget.BaseAdapter
    An abstract definition of an adapter for a ListView that displays a filtered List of books. The specific form this list takes is up to the derived class to implement.

    This class has been completely deprecated because this "all-in-one" style of Adapter does not play well with async databases like FireStore - the list would never be constructed properly.

    See Also:
    BaseAdapter, RequestList

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Deprecated. 
        A required method from BaseAdapter for getting the length of the internal list.
        Returns:
        The length of the internal filtered list

      • getItem

        public java.lang.Object getItem(int position)
        Deprecated. 
        A required method from BaseAdapter for getting an element of the internal list at a given position.
        Parameters:

      • inflate_helper

        protected android.view.View inflate_helper(android.view.View convertView,
                                           android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                           int xml)
        Deprecated. 
        A helper method that helps a subclass to inflate a row of a ListView.
        Parameters:
        convertView - The BaseAdapter's given View at this position to convert into a row of the internal list
        parent - The ViewGroup containing the elements of the ListView
        xml - A unique identifying integer referring to the ID of the XML layout resource file that contains the View each row will be built on
        Returns:
        The original given View, converted into a row of the internal list
